website_summaries.verdict: A superb soundbar that has impressive sound quality, solid construction, and a sleek design for a great price.
pros: Users love the vibrant sound, ease of set up, and excellent volume and sound quality
Its elegant design blends seamlessly with any room, and it's easy to group with other Sonos speakers
It gets top marks for holding up well to years of use
You can use it alone and love the sound quality
cons: Some felt it was expensive for a soundbar speaker, and a few felt it wasn't complete without the separately sold subwoofer unit

customer_reviews.title: TV and movies sound great, but I have rediscovered music with this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sound bar to go with my 65" OLED TV so I would get great sound while watching movies. It achieved that goal, but what I never expected was how good music sounds on this and how nice the Sonos app is for finding music. I paired it with a Sonos subwoofer which I highly recommend and now there are nights where I never turn the TV on, but just listen to albums I loved from my past and new music. Totally delightful.
customer_reviews.author: Chip Atl

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is garbage stay away
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sounds quality and that's the only positive I have to say about Sonos. Their app is horrendous and their many connectivity issues. The last thing I want to do when I come home is unplug all of my speaks and then physically connect them to a Ethernet cable so I can reinstall them onto my network. The gimmicky wifi connection (superior sounds blah blah blah) I get great sounds from Bluetooth speakers with Michael better functionality. Stay away from these overpriced paperweights
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sonos will collect, aggregate and sell your data
customer_reviews.text: It is weird that streaming music from hardware you own to hardware you own over a network you control means that Sonos can collect your data but that's what their new privacy policy allows. By hardware with cables that you can connect to to play music from. Enough of this data collection crap.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Burke

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs way up.
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised I haven't reviewed this yet! I hooked this up to my girlfriend's pair of Play 3's in her living room in order to set up [surround] sound for her TV/AppleTV. We moved the 3's to rear surrounds and use just the Playbar under the TV. I have to say, despite being an audiophile and knowing full well that Sonos doesn't come close to leading the pack in terms of raw fidelity... I almost don't care because they sound great and Sonos makes it sooooo painless to set things up. Within moments (and virtually zero effort on our part), we had beautiful surround sound for movies!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W

customer_reviews.title: No more annoying bluetooth!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. The sound is incredible, the user interface and iPhone app work amazingly, and for my simple apartment setup the soundbar itself is *definitely* getting the job done. I'll eventually buy a set or two of the surround sound speakers, but for now it is nice to know that I have a nice, functional, wireless audio solution. Trust me when I say, as a person that makes software, it is not easy to make an app that works this well. Not needing to sync up with bluetooth is a God send, and with full Spotify integration I can queue up any music that I want to!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia L. Mann

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with samsung 60inch ks 8000 model - UN60KS8000FXZA
customer_reviews.text: Bought below* set due to high ratings and have been trying to setup system. Have spend hours trying to pair remote w/ playbar with no success. Samsung is one of popular TV and Sonos should list down the tv models they don't support / work to not waste customer's time. To be fair, sound quality seems amazing but what's point if it doesn't work with my tv. *
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: Most Difficult Set Up Ever
customer_reviews.text: When trying to set up a new soundbar, the Sonos app failed to connect my phone to the speaker. There is no way to now connect the soundbar to wifi which then leads to the app to a Checking for Updates screen. Since it can't connect, it can't check for updates. There is a more options buttons, but that does no good. Customer service is closed, 6:00 on the west coast is a bit early. I would not recommend Sonos at this time.
customer_reviews.author: harlin

customer_reviews.title: Does  not work through amplifier
customer_reviews.text: When the installer arrived, discovered this does not work through an amplifier. Only connects to TV. So if you have a lot of peripherals that you want to hear sound through, this will not work, alas. The installer spent a lot of time trying to get it to work. Had to buy acoustic speakers and again pay someone to connect, and out the $$ to return the items. Really wish it had worked on my system but alas not. So beware if you want to connect through an amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Sears

customer_reviews.title: The sound of angels... like a combination of Fergie and Jesus.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously - the thing is amazing. From the ease of use to the quality of the sound. We have really enjoyed the Alexa pairing. The speaker has brought the home TV/movie experience to a new level. I realize it is a bit expensive, but it was worth every penny. My ONLY complaint was needing to hard wire connect it to my home router for the setup - my router sits in hard to access/remote location in my home and I worried about damaging the speaker getting it there... otherwise, I am incredible impressed.
customer_reviews.author: RWNJ

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, replicates LCR very well, bass is better than I thought.
customer_reviews.text: I have a decent 5.1 Home Theater, and I am astonished at how well this soundbar can replicate a front sound stage. I was concerned that I would need the subwoofer, and if this wasnt just replacing the TV speakers then yes, I would. But then I'd also need two rear speakers. This is great for the family room, nice look and wife loves that its only one speaker with very few cables! Connected our two other play 1's for whole house Amazon Music!
customer_reviews.author: C. G.

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar was a pleasure to set up and the sound is wonderful. The Sonos company has done something I thought was impossible. The set up and quality was the easiest process imaginable. It was like I had a technician in the room with me. The sound bar is expensive but what I will remember is the ease of set up and the great sound. Hats off to sono.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: I love the convenience and amazed by the sound Sonos is ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the convenience and amazed by the sound Sonos is able to provide in a wireless speaker system. There is no doubt I was skeptical at first but have become a believer. I have the Playbar paired with a sub and two Play 1's for a pseudo 5.1 setup. It sounds awesome and fills my large living room whether I am listening to tunes or immersed in a movie. I have my Sonos system paired with my home automation system and love that I can queue up music tied a specific lighting scene or mood.
customer_reviews.author: Slackerstech

customer_reviews.title: Sounds is incredible
customer_reviews.text: Set this up and I love the sound from it. I have it connected with Alexa and the music sounds great. Watching the TV does no longer turning the volume up and down to hear speech. Everything is crystal clear and I can basically set the volume to what ever I like and leave it there. It is a shame that you need to buy accessories to actually hear your TV but if you are in the marked this is what I would recommend. I have tried others and have had issues with them. I will be keeping this though.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Irish

customer_reviews.title: Hard To Beat The Sound
customer_reviews.text: After several months of research, we went ahead and purchased this soundbar and I'm really glad I did. The Sonos soundbar got consistently top ratings among several rating sources, including Consumer Reports and after owning it for a while I understand why. Based purely on sound quality it would be difficult if not impossible to beat. We have a large, open Den and the sound bar has no problem filling the room with crisp, clear sound. It sounds better than the Pioneer 5.1 system it replaced even without additional speakers. Only wish it had Airplay.
customer_reviews.author: zilchBlack

customer_reviews.title: Unusable for TV and movies
customer_reviews.text: This playbar is advertised for TV but it is absolute garbage for TV and movies. The audio is all over the place - wildly loud at random times, completely muffled on audio at other times. Sonos released a “fix” that boosts vocals on media/movies but it does little to remedy this problem. Many forums document this issue. It’s decent for music, but the whole idea is that it’s supposed to create a surround system with my Play 1s. What a shame and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy

customer_reviews.title: Stunning audio quality
customer_reviews.text: I merely got this to solve the chronic problem of voice clarity. Out of the box, I was blown away by the crisp clarity of soundbar, which also picked up my Gen2 Play5 stereo setup. This is thrilling, fulfilling our passion for opera but sounding better than a first row seat at the Metropolitian Opera, audience to the rear. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: J. Trimpey

customer_reviews.title: Love my Soundbar
customer_reviews.text: I now have 5 Sonos 1's and the Playbar. I was skeptical of spending so much money for a sound bar, but since I had the Sonos 1's and was completely happy with them, I chose to make the jump. Completely happy with this unit. We use it for music as well as TV and add 2 of the 1's located in the living room with the sound bar while watching TV. The best part of the Sonos system is the ability to utilize your speakers in so many different ways via cell, ipad, and computer.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Sauerzopf

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: I dont leave reviews really but decided for the amount of money spent and the amount i plan to invest i wanted to share my experiance. I purchased the PlayBar and two Play 1's the setup was simple and used my wifes Iphone for TrueSound (disapointed as ANDRIOID is better). The Sounds quailty is cyrstal clear from the surrond sound setup for Movies and listening to music. Love the fact i can have it both ways. I dont have the sub and really dont need it BUT it is on my wish list. After that i plan on purchasing the PLAY 5's for each room and out door area!
customer_reviews.author: Firstorder

customer_reviews.title: Forced Obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: Great system. Have purchased 3 different speakers over time. Loved the products until they announced their new forced obsolescence. Not another dollar. I'd return this Playbar if I could. Would never have invested so much in a speaker system if I had known, but of course they're not going to tell you that up front. Bye Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my money and time.
customer_reviews.text: OMG. Why can’t it just work like all my other over priced items (Apple devices, Bose systems, harmon/kardon?? So many hoops to jump through then support expects me to install some Trojan horse so that they can give me support. Worst set up experience of my life.
customer_reviews.author: anthony sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound bar but the surround is weak..
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy the hype that this will replace a full 5.1(+) system, it won't. But it passes the wife test and most movies don't have that great of surround sound anyway (I guess the gimmick ran it's course). That said if you don't think it's going to be a surround sound replacement then you'll have an amazing sound bar. I definitely recommend getting the woofer.. The bar and the woofer paired together is WAAAAY better.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Audio link is most important
customer_reviews.text: It's a worthwhile purchase, considering SW. When linking to your tv source, be sure to set the sound quality to your preference. My samsung has settings for clear voice, movie, amplify, etc. Set your settings for what you prefer, and then connect to sound bar. I use amplify, and I'm happy with that setting.
customer_reviews.author: oanrai

customer_reviews.title: Do not Buy if you have an iPhone
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because you could stream music from your iphone on the device. Sonos then decided to remove that feature, making this a waste of $700. Get a different device.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but....
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound and the concept, but soundbar constantly “loses” itself from the network. Sub and rears work, but you have to plug and unplug to reset. Also hate the strictly WiFi. Our router broke on Christmas Eve and we were stuck with no audio for our party. Definitely consider the Bose if you are a Bluetooth user.
customer_reviews.author: Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and very easy to set up. The only caveat I have is it's integration with my echo dot. It's not as seamless as my grain audio. It's not bluetooth which is great but I hate having to tell Alexa to command the sound with the name of the playbar. It's annoying. The instructions says the set up is still in beta mode. I'm hoping for an update soon.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Craig

customer_reviews.title: Worst software EVER
customer_reviews.text: UNBELIEVABLE problems with software. Right now, a year later, I am unable to mute TV or add speakers in another room. Sometimes, Sonos will CONTINUE TO PLAY even after I have closed the app AND SHUT THE PC DOWN. Sometimes the TV plays thru the Sonos speakers, and sometimes all I get are the tinny speakers that come with the TV. WHEN the sound is right, it does fill the room wonderfully, however, no software should EVER BE THIS BAD, for any application.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis C. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: High quality sound
customer_reviews.text: It's not that I don't love it... I do, I just wish they'd add Bluetooth capability to expand the range of devices you can use with it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Moren

customer_reviews.title: Easy, effective, and great tv sound.
customer_reviews.text: Very clear sound. It makes using speakers easy. We always used a second remote to adjust the previous sound system's volume- the sonos just works. I have it connected with a pair of play 1s for surround sound and it's truly a better experience. Once in a while the playbar gets a few milliseconds out of sync with the rest of the play 1s in the house when playing music, it's usual enough that I ignore it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Willert

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent and  insulation and setup is 15 mins.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the easiest sound system I’ve ever own and setup. The sound is outstanding. I pulled my receiver and Surroundsound speakers out. I’ve got bare shelves, and it’s doesn’t look like an electrical fire waiting to happen. I own this unit plus the sub and two speakers. I’m going to buy two more speakers for my living room for music. I read on a post that you can’t adjust this unit. That’s not true the whole system is adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and great app
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality. I was a little reluctant because it is expensive but the Sonos app works great and it gives great quality audio. I love the ability to play music on several Sonos devices simultaneously throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: A Farser

customer_reviews.title: Great soundbar, great music device, great product. Just pricey.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite SONOS device. Unlike other devices, you can use this as a standalone unit and it's still worth the cost. The sound you get out of it is amazing. What's better is that you can use it as a room speaker for music and it sounds just as good as normal speakers and a receiver. The only downside to this is the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Concepcion D. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Sonos has changed the rules and has removed functionality
customer_reviews.text: you are now required to have a mobile device and to enable location services. if you do not allow them access to location services, they can not find sonos speakers on your own network. why they need to know what town i live in to find the speakers in my house boggles my mind.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Damn thing wouldnt connect!
customer_reviews.text: Tried everything and just couldnt get the damn thing to connect, even after multiple resets etc! Keep in mind it was an Amazon Warehouse item but it looked brand new
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Solution for Me!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a 5.1 surround sound system for my bedroom and I did not want to deal with wires at all. This Sonos PlayBar, Sub, and two Play 1 speakers turned out to be the perfect solution for me. I am really pleased with this set up and the Sonos products are well worth the money in my opinion. Whether I'm watching TV, watching an action movie, or listening to music, the sound is amazing. Sonos can count me as a customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Eddster

customer_reviews.title: SONOS= Inflexible and Intrusive...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product; can’t pair with Bluetooth, can’t pair with hard-wired sound component, must use Sonos app, (which of course collects tons of personal data). I wasn’t even able to test sound quality (using Spotify from my iPhone) because the Sonos app insisted that I hook the device to a television! Very rigid company/product!
customer_reviews.author: David Lovell Jr (lovell4205@aol.com)

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I unpackaged, placed, and setup these speakers in under an hour! That includes all my shenanigans with other projects going on that served to distract me. The app setup is really user friendly, and it even prompted me to reconfigure my speakers when I had missed a step and was doing it wrong. Really intuitive. The sound is absolutely amazing. I'm using the Soundbar, 2 Play 1's, and a Sub for my living room TV and paired it with my Amazon Echo. Honestly could not be happier with the setup. Will obviously update this review if that changes, but first impressions mean a great deal, and this system is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished, NOT BRAND NEW
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I purchased this in November and it stoped working February 17th. When I called Sonos they were very helpful., but I found out that my sound bar was refurbished. It was sold to me as brand new. The price was the same as a brand new unit. How dare they. Now they are sending me another refurbished unit.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Tasso

customer_reviews.title: Great sounds quality but with some inconvenience
customer_reviews.text: * Great sounds quality * Versatile setup configurations without sounds quality degradation (flat low profile, vertical narrow profile, or wall mount) * Easy setup * Downer - had to change my TV remote from Bluetooth to line-of-sight IR mode to control volume of sound bar. Resulted in loss of remote functionality like voice assistant (Sony Bravia TV) * Frustration - after I play content from my phone to the sound bar, I have trouble switching the sound source back to the TV * Wish the sounds bar had HDMI/ARC connection option
customer_reviews.author: David Wood

customer_reviews.title: AmaZing product
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t be happier, I have a smaller living room and had been looking at options. Love the sound bar, amazing sound and easy to install mount. System not only looks clean but sounds perfect. Can’t wait to add to it with other Sonos products
customer_reviews.author: Darin Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money...!!!
customer_reviews.text: Spoken dialogue is too quiet while action scenes are window-shaking loud. I have to sub titles on to follow any movie. Went back to tv speakers...Bad outcome based on the high price of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Highly, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC. There's a ton of reviews, and I'm not sure I have anything else to add. So I'll summarize: Great sound, great UI, easy to set up, very high "Wife Acceptance Factor". Using it with a sub and a pair of Play 1's for 5.1 in the "main" or "den" room. FANTASTIC I was a little reluctant to spend the money. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Danal

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Our teevee audio is now a thousand times better. I picked up the sound bar and subwoofer and are looking forward to adding a couple of play 1s when I have a room more suited for surround sound. The sound from these components are rich and deep. After putting in hundreds of hours into playing Fallout 4, I have heard sounds that I didn't even know I was missing until we upgraded to the sonos system. Set up was stupid easy and the companion app is really useful for control. My only draw back so far is I can't have both my XBox and PlayStation remotes programed for volume control, only one or the other.
customer_reviews.author: John B Hedges Jr

customer_reviews.title: $10 Wall mounted. 3yrs strong.
customer_reviews.text: 3 years later and still loving it. I highly advise going with 2 Snap Togglers if your wall mounting (screw in second pic). These each hold 50—100lbs, pending which rating you buy. Measure your soundbar holes' distance, then throw a level on your measured lines. $10 to wall mount. Add a cable feeder behind (check local codes on power).
customer_reviews.author: BrassAndStripes

customer_reviews.title: An ok buy. Better choices to be had if you are a sound nut.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't impressed with the sound quality of this thing. Mind you that I was upgrading from a 10 plus year old Bose system. The sound seems too processed. If this is your first soundbar, you might notice a difference and actually like it. I went from 5.1 setup to this and the sub to save on space. Only pro, it saves space. Also it's a it annoying that your phone can't connect to it via Bluetooth and you have to essentially use SONOS app to stream all your music thru the bar.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and muddled sound.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality would be bad on a cheap sound bar, let alone this product. The sound is often muddled and dialogue and other sounds get lost in the wash. Not a great experience for casual TV, movies, or music. Only positive is the volume works well with universal remotes.
customer_reviews.author: JustinK

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: I love this sound bar! I really debated buying it because of the cost; I do not spend that much lightly. Now that I have it, I have to say that I enjoy it every single day. It is not just a great speaker for my t.v., it connects to my other Sonos speakers to give me amazing music streaming too. The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound - could be more functional
customer_reviews.text: This is an expensive but great sound bar. The speech enhancement and night sound features are great. Like all Sonos product, you would need to control via Sonos app (if your Smart TV doesnt detect to be able to control from its remote). However at such an expensive price point - a standalone remote control would have been great. The Sonos app interface is also not the best. Overall happy with product but could more functional.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Superb Soundbar
customer_reviews.text: Arrived early. Packaging really protects the soundbar well. Setup took about 10 minutes, but was straightforward. The sound quality is superb. The only con I noted was it was challenging to connect the soundbar as a speaker to my Amazon echo system. Overall this unit is worth the money, and sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Ireflyfish

customer_reviews.title: Expectations not met. Old app and several issues to connect
customer_reviews.text: I guess my expectations were too high for this product and when it arrived and I started to have problems to connect it with my wifi at the point to have to wire it to my router my opinion drastically changed. In a world with so many smart devices this was by far the worst initial experience that I had. I hope to change it in the next days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is HANDS DOWN the best quality listening experience I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Sonos is HANDS DOWN the best quality listening experience I have ever had. I now have them all over my house and this on my family room TV paired with 2 Play:1s. I've got the whole lineup minus the sub and can't stop raving about em!
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Harding

customer_reviews.title: Now working great and we love it
customer_reviews.text: This unit was somewhat difficult to set up at my second residence because I already had one and I could not connect to the network. Spent a couple of hours on the phone with Sonos reps, tech took control of my computer and fixed the problem--great quick response. Now working great and we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I love all my Sonos products. They sound great, are easy to setup and control any number of ways. The only down side to this, for some reason I am not able to get my Samsug remote to sync with the volume of the sound bar. It works just fine with my cable remote. Overall I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: I love Sonos speakers and the sound they produce. I have recommend them to several of my co-workers. I plan on buy more speakers for around the house
customer_reviews.author: C. Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: The sound is great and works with our other Sonos speaker
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great and works with our other Sonos speaker. We had bought a cheaper soundbar before and it went bad after maybe a year or so. This definitely sounds way better and hopefully it will last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Mr&MrsR

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality was not the high level I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Five stars for easy of installation and use with the internet. Their app works perfectly and the we expect to enjoy the easy access to movies and music. However, after reading the rave reviews, I had high expectations for the sound quality. The sound is NOT high-quality stereo sound. We are not impressed. Clearly, to get the level of sound we had expected, we will need to lay out another $700 for the accompanying subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: Dagmar715

customer_reviews.title: Decent 5.1 surround system, better for playing music
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I misread (I did) but thought the sound bar integrated with Sub and other surround speakers on its own via wireless. Not so, had to buy a Boost to complete setup. Easy to set up. It could use a little more options when used as a surround system but other than that very happy with system. The app for control leaves a little to be desired when it comes to adding music libraries. Itunes downloaded "ok" but the album artwork is all jacked up. Options for sorting the music good be better. Volume control setup for the Dish remote was easy as well
customer_reviews.author: R. A.

customer_reviews.title: As advertised and received when promised.
customer_reviews.text: Love this soundbar. I was forced to go wireless as I couldn't string speaker wire here without tearing up drywall. I was skeptical because I had a great receiver and surround system. This, along with the subwoofer and a couple of Play 1's produce a great sound. My only complaint is that after a month I'm still struggling to be able to play my iTunes library and playlists. I am going to call SONOS for help with that. I've heard they have great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity is problematic
customer_reviews.text: Good luck trying to switch your WiFi router. Pain in neck. Customer service folks have no understanding of the issue. Solution to everything is “factory reset” from their point of view. So plan to drop half a day in unproductive work.
customer_reviews.author: Sudeep Goel

customer_reviews.title: Good system
customer_reviews.text: Good sound system. I like the idea of being able to group the speakers together for sound away from the soundbar, or use them individually. I am not as happy with the mobile app, since it doesn't support the "grouping" function. That has to be done on my computer (unless I've not figured out how to do it yet).
customer_reviews.author: Dave D

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect with minor caveats for home theater
customer_reviews.text: I really love this SONOS setup, the sound quality is good, ease of use is great and it's fantastic to play your music and other services directly on the speakers. For the soundbar though, with the main function being home theater, it would have been best to have a hdmi input instead of an optical one. It would also be much better if the soundbar could decode all commonly used surround sounds formats and not just Dolby Digital. Nevertheless I could configure my samsung TV and apple tv v4 to produce Dolby Digital and the sound works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry Fedorov

customer_reviews.title: Great Bar
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my Sonos system for 2 plus years and it’s not just that the sound it great but your also getting the Sonos app with free music of all kinds for your home system and Sonos only keeps improving their music services they are second to none in my humble opinion. Did I mention the sound is Great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Set-up and App Need Improvement, but Sound is Great
customer_reviews.text: An engineer had to walk through the instructions with me over the phone, but after that the device worked pretty well. There were minor hiccups with connection via the app, but nothing that breaks the entire thing.
customer_reviews.author: HyruleBorn

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, sleek look and works with the Echo
customer_reviews.text: We are so happy that we purchased this item. We spent a lot of time researching but in the end we went with this brand and could not be happier. It's got great sound, it's streamlined and fits below our wall mounted TV perfectly. Best of all I can control it with my Amazon Echo and play music off of it.
customer_reviews.author: Mason the Tator Tot

customer_reviews.title: Good product! Not sure why users are having trouble
customer_reviews.text: Sound is crystal clear. Not sure why users are having problems with the playbar being quiet then really loud. Sonos did an amazing job with there app and the sound synchronizing to which room you want it in. I did not receive the mounting bracket which was a bummer but still love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This soundbar is amazing - I used to have to spend hours hooking ...
customer_reviews.text: This soundbar is amazing - I used to have to spend hours hooking up my studio-level front, center and 2 sets of rear speakers to get good surround sound. The wires were a hassle and the look was not good. Then I got the Sonos soundbar, 2 of the PLAY:3 speakers and a SUB and I set up a BETTER system in under 10 minutes. Seriously - it really is that simple. The sound is incredibly clear and the surround works great - add in the SUB and you would never know everything was wireless. Then start streaming Amazon Music or Sirius XM and you really understand why this system is so great!

customer_reviews.title: Kings of Sound
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to say it. Sonos are the Kings of Sound. Unquestionably the best audio solution I’ve heard for listening to music. The Best. Period. In our living room we. Have the Play Bar, Sub Woofer, and two Play 3’s for satellites. It sounds incredible. The only down-side is that the back speakers keep cutting out. That’s a REAL bummer! However I cannot get over how great it sound enough to switch to another system. I cannot get over how it sometimes cuts out (back speakers stop working)....so I cannot justify paying the high price to get other speakers. Otherwise I would. It’s a keeper..until we save up for Bose. More to come.

customer_reviews.text: The Sonos sound bar is extremely high quality audio equipment coupled with the "Sonos Experience" which means it is very easy to set up, connect to to rest of your audio equipment, and connect to the output of your TV. It integrates into our living room extremely well and provides exceptional sound for both our TV/movie watching experience plus our music listening experience.

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and sounds fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Sound is beast. Love it. Music sounds great when loud, lacking bass, but that is expected. Sub needed, otherwise movies sound great to. Effortless control from tv to music from phone and vice versa. Not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Robb J. Passante

customer_reviews.title: Great sound from an easy to live with speaker.
customer_reviews.text: For those that want a simple solution for hooking up a great sound system to your TV, this is it. One simple connection to your TV and use the Sonos app to set up for the best sound. This unit eliminates the need for additional left and right speakers as this sound bar has them built in. Sound is very good but I would highly recommend the Sonos sub be added to this system for greater bass and better overall sound. Yes it is expensive, but you will love the sound and the ease of operation for not only your TV shows, but all your ITunes, Pandora, Spotify and many other services that it will play.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding audio quality.  Expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Looks very good, solid feel, nice quality acoustic cloth and aluminum trim. The sound quality is beautiful, especially on material that does not push its (understandably) limited bass output. I was surprise how open the sound stage is, and how neutral they sound while listening to human voice and piano recordings - always a demanding task for speakers of any size. Thoroughly recommended. (Hmm, tempted by the sub-woofer now!)
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas to replace an outdated Bose system. I couldn't afford to also get the subwoofer but the sound is still richer than what we had with our 3-2-1 system. It is simple to set up and I love that you can stream music from your devices seamlessly. We look forward to expanding the system over time.

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly easy to set up, and the sound is excellent. If you're already using Sonos for your music, this is the next logical step. There's no additional buttons to push, receivers to turn on, or remotes you need to keep track of. It just works, and the days of having to explain to your guests how to use your TV/home theater system are gone.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the sonos ecosystem
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to the sonos ecosystem. I love the flexibility of pairing with my play 1's. I waited over a year to pull the trigger, and I am glad I did as I have no regrets. I agree that for the price, there are probably better options if you are building a traditional surround system. Sonos continues to be a top notch company that puts out quality products and support. Looking forward to the release of TruePlay later on this year.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to sonos system
customer_reviews.text: I think the Sonos system is fantastic. I've had it for a few weeks now and had no problems. It works seamlessly right out of the box. The app works great and the sound is flawless 99% of the time (you might occasionally experience some static but I believe that has more to do with my network than the speakers). I have the play 1,3,5 and soundbar and love how it works so easily and intuitively. Guests are always impressed. Using pandora, spotify and other platforms work like sonos had them in mind in designing the product. I really can't recommend this enough.

customer_reviews.title: This was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up, and is easy to use. We love our Sonos system so we had be wanting to add this soundbar to our den room since we cannot access above the ceiling to install in-ceiling speakers in the room. The sound is fantastic, and it was a great way to significantly improve the sound of our family TV while also expanding our Sonos music system to another room.
